head.title: Johnson and Tindall Collect Ivy Titles

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Fashion, Beauty and Fitness

hedline.hl1: Johnson and Tindall Collect Ivy Titles

abstract.p: Enda Johnson of Brown wins Heptagonal Games Assn men's cross-country title (S)

block.p: Enda Johnson of Brown, a junior from Ireland who broke his right foot last March during the indoor season, captured the Heptagonal Games Association men's cross-country title, covering the five-mile course at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx in 24 minutes 56.3 seconds yesterday.

Johnson scored a 25-yard victory over Tom McArdle (25:00.2), a sophomore who led Dartmouth to the team title with 55 points. The Big Green has now won the championship 13 times. Steve Sundell of Columbia (25:11.9) was fifth.
Sara Tindall, a senior at Brown, retained her title in the women's 3.1-mile race, winning in 17:32.8. Yale won the team championship for the first time since 1989 with 47 points.
In the Big East Conference championships at Boston's Franklin Park, Keith Kelly of Providence, runner-up a year ago, won in 23:21 to help the Friars regain the team title with 39 points.
Ann McGranahan of Villanova was the women's gold medalist in 16:59. Megan Guiney, runner-up in 17:03, led Boston College to the team crown with 38 points.

Sara Tindall, a senior at Brown, retained her title in the women's 3.1-mile race, winning in 17:32.8. Yale won the team championship for the first time since 1989 with 47 points.
In the Big East Conference championships at Boston's Franklin Park, Keith Kelly of Providence, runner-up a year ago, won in 23:21 to help the Friars regain the team title with 39 points.
Ann McGranahan of Villanova was the women's gold medalist in 16:59. Megan Guiney, runner-up in 17:03, led Boston College to the team crown with 38 points.
